p: SARS-CoV-2 (about 120 nm in diameter) is an enveloped, positive-sense single-stranded RNA (26–32 kb) virus that belongs to the genus Betacoronavirus of the family Coronaviridae in the Nidovirales order. The subgroups of the family are alpha (α), beta (β), gamma (γ) and delta (δ) coronaviruses [ 6]. During the last two decades, several highly pathogenic human coronaviruses have emerged including SARS-CoV in 2002–2003, MERS-CoV in 2012 [ 1] and SARS-CoV-2 in 2019.
